summary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Thursday 6 January to end of Thursday 6 January GMT
description: A cold clear start to Thursday with some sunshine. Wind and rain arriving later. <br/><br/>There may be a local build-up of pollution overnight into Thursday morning in very cold temperatures and almost calm conditions. From early afternoon a southerly breeze is expected to pick-up, increasing and becoming westerly by late evening. This developing 'clean' Atlantic breeze from early afternoon should ensure any pollution build-up early in the day is rapidly dispersed.<br/><br/>Overall, air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>PM10 Particulates<br/>PM2.5 Particulates. <br/><br/>
disclaimerText: This is for learning purpose and does not reflect real data source. See https://next.github.com/projects/flat-data for Flat Data Info
